project_abstract.cdata: The Telecommunications Sector Reform Technical Assistance Project, will strengthen policy, and regulatory frameworks to enhance private investments, and competition in the telecommunications sector in India. The components will support the Department of Telecommunications (DoT) to strengthen its policy making capacity; and, modernize the Wireless Planning, and Coordination (WPC) wing's radio frequency management. This includes financing of software, and hardware equipment, in addition to capacity building, and, the capacity of the Telecommunications Engineering Center will be strengthened, reviewing implications of telecommunications developments on sector policy in the country. Assistance to DoT, and WPC will include financing of equipment, consulting services, and training. The automated spectrum management system will include work-stations with suitable servers connected in LAN/WAN networks, while the WPC computer system, and LAN/WAN configuration, will include dual servers, with a capacity to hold the operational database, digitized topographic model database, as well as monitoring application, and office automation programs.
